description: The operation in Bradford South sees 175 offences reported to police.
title: Dozens of law-breaking drivers caught in Bradford crackdown
title_page: Dozens of law-breaking drivers caught in Bradford crackdown - BBC News
maintext:
More than 170 driving offences were reported to police in Bradford as part of a clampdown on dangerous driving in February.
Officers from West Yorkshire Police's Operation Steerside team joined forces with neighbourhood officers to target poor driving in the Bradford South area.
They focused on driver behaviours with the biggest risk of serious or fatal collisions, such as drink driving or using a handheld phone at the wheel.
The operation led to two arrests for driving while over the limit and eight vehicles being seized, while 44 drivers were caught speeding and 29 were caught driving without a seat belt.
